Is this all? And what are the times i.e. what's the sequence. It might be that semantic highlighting produced some illegal range. Can you reproduce this?

No, I cannot reproduce, and it has not happened again.  I originally entered the bug because it was a NPE and sometimes, these are easy to fix based on just a stack trace. The three stack traces happened in this order: IAE, BPCE, NPE.
Sorry I still cannot give you a reproducible case, but this still happens to me in the latest build I20061213-0800.  I will attach my log.

Created an attachment (id=55608)
log file

Also, because the exceptions are only put into the log, you get strange effects (like syntax coloring not working) and therefore it took me a while to realize something was broken.

I can move the bug from REMIND to ASSIGNED but that won't help much: it seems you are the only one seeing this and hence there's no chance to fix it. I assume this has to do with a specific source file you edit. Next time as soon as you see "strange effects" please reopen and tell us what file you were editing.
*** Bug 177834 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
